original_solution_mapping.L1: Jerome has 20 classmates on the list, and has half as many out of school friends on there so he has 20/2=<<20/2=10>>10 out of school friends on the contact list
original_solution_mapping.L2: He has 2 parents and 1 sister on the contact list, for 2+1= <<2+1=3>>3 family members on the contact list.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Adding the classmates, out of school friends and family members together we get 20+10+3=<<20+10+3=33>>33 people on his contact list

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1503.
    Returns: the total number of people on Jerome's contact list.
    """
    # L1
    classmates_count = 20 # 20 classmates on his cell phone contact list
    half_divisor = 2 # half as many out of school friends
    out_of_school_friends = classmates_count / half_divisor

    # L2
    parents_count = 2 # two parents
    sister_count = 1 # his sister
    family_members = parents_count + sister_count

    # L3
    total_people = classmates_count + out_of_school_friends + family_members

    # FA
    answer = total_people
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jerome has {classmates_count} classmates on the list, and has half as many out of school friends on there so he has {classmates_count}/{half_divisor}=<<{classmates_count}/{half_divisor}={out_of_school_friends}>>{out_of_school_friends} out of school friends on the contact list

He has {parents_count} parents and {sister_count} sister on the contact list, for {parents_count}+{sister_count}= <<{parents_count}+{sister_count}={family_members}>>{family_members} family members on the contact list.

Adding the classmates, out of school friends and family members together we get {classmates_count}+{out_of_school_friends}+{family_members}=<<{classmates_count}+{out_of_school_friends}+{family_members}={total_people}>>{total_people} people on his contact list

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jerome has 20 classmates on the list, and has half as many out of school friends on there so he has 20/2=<<20/2=10>>10 out of school friends on the contact list
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He has 20 parents and 1 sister on the contact list, for 20+1= <<20+1=21>>21 family members on the contact list.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Adding the classmates, out of school friends and family members together we get 20+10+21=<<20+10+21=51>>51 people on his contact list

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'classmates_count' (20) was used instead of 'parents_count' (2).
